data.title: Oracle DBA Resume
data.meta_description: 14 years of experience managing and supporting 24x7 production and development environments as an Oracle Database AdministratorExperience in Oracle software installation, configuration and patch applicationExperience in upgrading Oracle software to higher versions 7.x -> 8i -> 9i -> 10g -> 11g 12cGood knowledge of Oracle ArchitectureExperience with database tools like OEM, TOAD, SQL*Plus, Explain Plan, AWR, STATSPACK, ADDM, SQL*Loader, Export/Import, Data PumpImplementation of 10g OEM Control fo
data.text:
OVERVIEW:

Dedicated professional with extensive experience supporting production and development environments as an Oracle Database Administrator. Effective team player with excellent communication, analysis and problem - solving skills. Outstanding project and team leader. Able to coordinate and direct all phases of project-based efforts while managing, motivating, and guiding teams. Exceptional corporate citizen actively helping the department and the company to go from good to great.

SUMMARY:

14 years of experience managing and supporting 24x7 production and development environments as an Oracle Database Administrator

Experience in Oracle software installation, configuration and patch application

Experience in upgrading Oracle software to higher versions 7.x -> 8i -> 9i -> 10g -> 11g 12c

Good knowledge of Oracle Architecture

Experience with database tools like OEM, TOAD, SQL*Plus, Explain Plan, AWR, STATSPACK, ADDM, SQL*Loader, Export/Import, Data Pump

Implementation of 10g OEM Control for database monitoring and alert notification

Sound knowledge of PL/SQL i.e., writing packages, procedures, functions and triggers.

Experience with Data Guard setup and configuration with RAC

Install and configuration of Hyperion application

Experience with database backup, cloning and schema refresh

Expertize in database Migration and Consolidation

Ability to work on all flavors of Unix

Working knowledge of SQL Server

Remote database connectivity management using tnsnames, OID LDAP and Names Server

Good understanding of UNIX Kernel parameters

Expert in Data Migration from Sql server and DB2 to Oracle done several for IBM and IRS

Generate and analyze Oracle STATSPACK,AWR,ADDM,ASH Reports

Ability to work on multiple projects and with multiple development teams simultaneously

Automation of day-to-day DBA tasks using SHELL scripts and CRON jobs

Expertise in troubleshooting the problems related to databases and applications

Manage onsite and offshore co-ordination and communication

Good Knowledge in installing, configuring oracle applications UIM, IPSA, OSM, IPM, Metasolv, WFM

Expert Knowledge in setting up databases for these applications UIM, IPSA, OSM, IPM, Metasolv, WFM

Maintaining good relationships with application owners and developers

Good working knowledge of RMAN

Good working knowledge of Oracle Golden Gate setup

Good Knowledge of Oracle Transparent Gateways

Expert in Conducting DR activities.

Good working knowledge of SAP Support on Oracle Databases

Good Knowledge of working On Call Shifts.

TECHNICAL SKILLS:

Platform/OS: Sun Solaris, HP-UX 11.0, LINUX, Tru-64, Windows

Databases/RDBMS: Oracle 12c, 11g, 10g, 9i, 8i, 7.x

Tools: /Utilities:: TOAD,PL/SQL Developer, 10g OEM Console, SQL*Plus, Explain Plan, TKPROF, STATSPACK, ADDM,ASH,AWRRMAN, SQL*Loader, Export/Import, Data Pump

Programming/Languages: UNIX Shell Programming

EXPERIENCE:

Confidential

Oracle DBA

Environment: Linux/Aix/Hp Unix/Sun Solaris, Oracle 8,9,10g RAC,11

Responsibilities:

Extracted data from db2 environment to oracle environment.

Familiar using control center in db2 and also used aqua data studio.

Worked extensively to resolve Help Desk Tickets.

Involved in new requirements like ICE screen, Brad Ford Group & national reports as per business requirements.

Setting up SAP databases on Unix Servers.

Having very good exposure to star and snow flake schemas (using primary and foreign keys)

Tuned sql statements, Suggested and Implemented indexes for faster retrieval of data in various procedures/packages as per business requirements.

Troubleshoot Issues with help desk based on user requirements.

Scheduled Cron jobs as per business requirements.

Wrote, Modified and troubleshooting the existing stored procedures/packages based on user requirement.

Loaded data using cron jobs and scheduling procedures/packages as per business requirements.

Maintained several versions of Banner ERP software and the associated oracle databases and Application Servers appropriate for the version. The modules that I was involved in were General, AR, Position Control, Document Management, Payroll, HR, Finance, Web Tailor, Web for General, Employee Self Service, Finance Self Service, and CALBHR. This included setting up Cascade for the Self Service Products.

Drawn flow diagrams as per business requirements.

Migrating 9i databases to 10g

Developing procedures and functions in 11i

Copying Schemas to new environments as required by developers.

Applying Patches.

Managed the Banner software code tree

Writing PL/SQL code (Functions, Packages, Procedures)

Using OEM to setup jobs.

Logical and Physical Database design for Rapid Roadside Assistance Program.

Provided a data architecture design to eliminate discrepancies in managerial and legal results.

Dimensional Data modeling for Cubes and hierarchies designing the database using star schema and snow flake schema.

Confidential

Oracle DBA

Responsibilities:

Writing Korn Shell Scripting setting Crontab jobs to monitor the database

Setting up jobs through OEM

Applying new schema changes

Tuning Scripts

Cloning and Restoring Databases using hot and cold backups.

Writing functions, packages, procedures extensively.

Provided an evaluation and Proof of Concept (built a Star Schema for the Billing Database )

Refreshing the database.

Database Archiving using Optim.

Confidential

Oracle DBA

Responsibilities:
